ratings.comment: Overall great professor. Lectures are clear and concise, weekly quizzes take 30 mins and are very easy, homework assignments are easy with most answers available online. The exams are conceptual (not computational) and can be difficult. Midterm 1 very easy, midterm 2 very difficult, final not too bad. Nick is a nice guy and his class is pretty easy

This teacher is a very tough grader. When they (teacher and TA) lose a homework assignment, they just give you a zero and tell you to get over it. Midterms get harder (Avg. for Midterm 1 was 76%, avg for 2 was 55%). Grades essays hard. I had him read my paper and submitted it early for extra credit and still got a F. Pray for the curve.
Gets off topic a lot in class. Talks so fast where you cant write things down. Very mean tone and demeanor while teaching. Grading exams very hard.

Nick is a cool guy and concise lecturer. Lectures consisted on doing practice problems, solving statistics problems, math and formulas. Exams were opposite, almost all word problems with the ideas never stated in class with only like 1 actual mathematical statistic question. Other sections +15% higher on exams, his exam averages rarely passed 60%.

Nic is condescending, and even if you ask him a question, he's not afraid to mock you in front of the whole class. He rushes through the lectures, and the exams are lengthy and wordy (even though it's a stats course). DO NOT TAKE WITH HIM. BEWARE.

He is hands down the worst teacher Ive ever had. Im pretty smart and try really hard but that didnt seem to matter in this class. Weekly quizzes take 1-2 hours to complete when theyre only 5 questions, hes condescending and mocks you when you ask questions, and he makes the tests impossible. Other classes had 15% higher class avgs than ours.

I got a 5 on AP stats and still struggle with and hate this class. It has nothing to do with life science, it's identical to computer science stats class down to the dumb examples.  Keuler is ok but a pretty poor teacher and he always makes it seem like we're a burden on him. He also has some weird objection to practice exams. Take 301 instead.

Our lecture was behind so he rushed all the material towards the end. Due to this, he could only gloss over key concepts and examples. This clearly was reflected in our exam,the final for our lecture was around 54%. He was very nice in the beginning, but became increasingly sassy and condescending. Overall, he was alright. Tough, but alright.

Dude is an interesting guy and you get a good vibe from him. He spices lecture up every once in a while by making an actually laughable joke. I couldn't imagine with how boring this subject already is, not having him for a teacher. Doesn't make you get the textbook, but you probably won't want to miss too many lectures. Good guy,  terrible subject.

Nick is an interesting guy. He does his best to make lectures entertaining, and while his jokes are legitimately funny, they're overshadowed by painstakingly boring lectures that would be great as powerpoints (Nick, please!) a piece of paper projected on a screen. Also, his objection to giving out practice exams is questionable. Try John Gillett!

Very clear and likable instructor. Tries really hard to make stats interesting--lots of funny anecdotes. Lectures follow book closely and are taught very clear. Weekly homework assignments are very easy, 2 midterms, and a tough final. Lecture attendance is necessary but section is nearly useless. Would highly recommend if you need to take 301!

Excellent professor! Defines expectations clearly, explains all the core concepts in great detail, works with examples and is a very, very funny guy! HW involves a lot of R computations (he shows you how to do them) and you MUST go to lecture in order to do well. Exams are easy if you keep up with the class and are graded very fairly.

I hated this class.  He tends to go on tangents and can be unstructured.  Would have been helpful to have R handouts or presentations in a computer lab because his in-lecture demonstrations were not memorable. Attending lecture is definitely a must because some material isn't covered in the book.

great teacher- first midterm is a breeze but second midterm is difficult even though it is pretty obvious what you need to study.  Final wasn't as difficult as I expected, but the curve was still pretty low. Office hours are a great help! Considering the subject material, he makes this class a lot of fun!

Great prof, one of the best I've ever had. Tests aren't a piece of cake but definitely do-able and you get notes sheets. Homework is totally reasonable. Tells really hilarious stories, not bad to look at either. If you can get him for stats, do it.
Makes something as boring as statistics easy and fun. Tests were on exactly what he said they would be. Great prof!
Makes a subject that I don't like entertaining.  Knows his stuff and wants you to know it too.
Great guy, manages to make boring statistics lecture something that you dont hate going to.  Funny stories, great examples, straightforward exams.
Great teacher. Explains concepts well, uses hilarious examples, tests and grades are fair.

Awesome Guy. Blew my mind the first day of class with how different he was from any other professor I have had. Fun, good stories, good examples. Tests are failry easy and makes Statistics, a not fun subjuect, into something bearable.

great sense of humor, makes lecture almost easy to sit thru and interesting (at least his stories and examples are interesting and usually make you laugh) - exams aren't too difficult and the curve is nice, and there's hardly any hw - definitely a cool guy, one of the best professors i've had
Lots of fun in lecture. Gets off topic easily and tells stories, but keeps things interesting. Presents material well.
